body_content.explanation: a plant that grows in hot regions, similar to a palm (= a tree that has a single trunk with a mass of long pointed leaves at the top) with large cones (= hard, dry, oval fruits), that was very common in the Triassic and Jurassic eras (= the period of time between around 245 and 146 million years ago):
examples: Cycads were once the most successful plant on the planet and were eaten by dinosaurs.
Some cycad species originated up to 250 million years ago.
